summary: Cluely is an invisible desktop assistant that leverages AI to assist users during virtual meetings and sales calls. It aims to transform how humans interact with technology by providing real-time support for tasks such as homework, meetings, and interviews.
product: An AI-powered desktop assistant that helps users in virtual meetings and sales calls by providing real-time assistance and insights. It enhances productivity and communication by being seamlessly integrated and unobtrusive.
team: Founded by an individual who initially created Cluely as a tool to cheat on technical interviews, successfully securing offers at top tech companies like Amazon, Meta, TikTok, and Capital. Specific names of founders or key team members are not provided.
traction: Raised $15 million in funding led by Andreessen, indicating strong investor confidence and market validation.
funding: Raised $15 million in a funding round led by Andreessen Horowitz.
market: Operates in the AI-powered productivity tools market, targeting virtual meetings, sales calls, and educational use cases, fitting into the broader market of workplace collaboration and communication technology.
